\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-ai.ai}}\index{ai.ai (module)}\index{AI (class in ai.ai)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.ai.AI}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ai.ai.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{AI}}}{\emph{rec=None}, \emph{db\_path=None}, \emph{extra\_payload=\{\}}, \emph{user='testuser'}, \emph{rec\_score\_file='rec\_state.obj'}, \emph{verbose=True}, \emph{warm\_start=False}, \emph{n\_recs=1}, \emph{datasets=False}}{}
AI managing agent for Penn AI.

Responsible for:
- checking for user requests for recommendations,
- checking for new results from experiments,
- calling the recommender system to generate experiment recommendations,
- posting the recommendations to the API.
- handling communication with the API.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rec}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{recommender to use}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{db\_path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{base path to the database server}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{extra\_payload}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{any additional payload that needs to be specified}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{user}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{the user for this AI instance.}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rec\_score\_file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pickled score file to keep persistent scores between}}) \textendash{} sessions

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{JasonEncoder (class in ai.ai)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.ai.JasonEncoder}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ai.ai.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{JasonEncoder}}}{\emph{*}, \emph{skipkeys=False}, \emph{ensure\_ascii=True}, \emph{check\_circular=True}, \emph{allow\_nan=True}, \emph{sort\_keys=False}, \emph{indent=None}, \emph{separators=None}, \emph{default=None}}{}~\index{default() (ai.ai.JasonEncoder method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.ai.JasonEncoder.default}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{default}}}{\emph{obj}}{}
Implement this method in a subclass such that it returns
a serializable object for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{o}}, or calls the base implementation
(to raise a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{TypeError}}).

For example, to support arbitrary iterators, you could
implement default like this:

\fvset{hllines={, ,}}%
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{default}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{o}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{k}{try}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{iterable} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n+nb}{iter}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{o}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{except} \PYG{n+ne}{TypeError}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{pass}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n+nb}{list}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{iterable}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Let the base class default method raise the TypeError}
    \PYG{k}{return} \PYG{n}{JSONEncoder}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{default}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n+nb+bp}{self}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{o}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}

\index{RandomRecommender (class in ai.recommender.random\_recommender)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.recommender.random_recommender.RandomRecommender}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ai.recommender.random\_recommender.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{RandomRecommender}}}{\emph{ml\_type='classifier'}, \emph{metric=None}, \emph{db\_path=''}, \emph{api\_key=''}, \emph{ml\_p=None}}{}
Penn AI random recommender.

Recommends random machine learning algorithms and parameters from the possible algorithms
fetched from the server.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

Used to determine ML options.

\item {}

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:module-ai.recommender.meta_recommender}}\index{ai.recommender.meta\_recommender (module)}
Recommender system for Penn AI.
\index{MetaRecommender (class in ai.recommender.meta\_recommender)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.recommender.meta_recommender.MetaRecommender}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ai.recommender.meta\_recommender.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MetaRecommender}}}{\emph{ml\_type='classifier'}, \emph{metric=None}, \emph{db\_path=''}, \emph{api\_key=''}, \emph{ml\_p=None}, \emph{sample\_size=100}}{}
Penn AI meta recommender.
Recommends machine learning algorithms and parameters as follows:
maintains an internal model of the form f\_d(ML,P,MF) = E
where
d is the dataset
ML is the machine learning
P is the ML parameters
MF is the metafeatures associated with d

to produce recommendations for dataset d, it does the following:
E\_a = f\_d(ML\_a,P\_a,MF\_d) prediction of performance of a on d
Sort E\_a for several a (sampled from ML+P options)
recommend top E\_a
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ml\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{'classifier'}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{'regressor'}}) \textendash{} Recommending classifiers or regressors. Used to determine ML options.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{metric}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default: accuracy for classifiers}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{mse for regressors}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The metric by which to assess performance on the datasets.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{best\_model\_prediction() (ai.recommender.meta\_recommender.MetaRecommender method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:ai.recommender.meta_recommender.MetaRecommender.best_model_prediction}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{best\_model\_prediction}}}{\emph{dataset\_id}, \emph{n\_recs=1}}{}

\index{update\_model() (ai.recommender.meta\_recommender.MetaRecommender method)}
